intro: Erysimum pulvinatum, commonly known as the purple heart or yellow wallflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with upright stems and basal leaves that are often lobed. Its flowers, which bloom in early spring, range in color from yellow to purple, depending on the variety. Erysimum pulvinatum is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
